== Who I am ==

I'm Kelsey - I'm a Kernel Developer with the Ubuntu Kernel Team. I started with Canonical as a Kernel Engineering Intern in December 2019 and transitioned into a full-time Kernel Engineer position in June 2020.

I graduated from Colorado State University (Fort Collins, CO, USA) in 2020 with a Bachelor's in Computer Science. While in school and before joining Canonical, I held two other internships. I interned for a year with Hewlett-Packard Enterprise on their storage array testing team. I also spent the summer of 2019 with The Linux Foundation as part of their Linux Kernel Mentorship Program working to help clean up and enhance PCI and lspci.

Software engineering as a career wasn't always an obvious choice for me. so I come with experience in some extra areas including customer service, management, tech support, and (of course the most useful for Canonical) animal care & ranch hand.

== My Ubuntu story ==

I first downloaded Ubuntu 18.04 in 2018 while dual booting my macbook. I was curious about exploring different operating systems and it became a steep and slippery slope ever since. Ubuntu was the OS that caught my interest the most and quickly became my daily driver.

=== My involvement ===

I work on the Stable Kernel Team for Ubuntu which involves assisting with the SRU process. I assist with the preparation, testing, packaging, release, and maintenance of Ubuntu's stable kernels.

I primarily help with the SRU cycle which includes cranking kernels, ADT review, reviewing patches on the Kernel Mailing List, and back-porting and SRUing requested patches. I have now been Mailing List lead a handful of times and started training others for this role as well. I recently received a limited upload exception (for core kernels built in the main canonical-kernel-team PPA).

In addition, I've started to play small roles in assisting with FIPS and azure kernels. these roles include back-porting requested patches and preparing kernels for certification.

=== Upload Rights ===
I'm requesting upload rights for the kernel package set for all active series, which includes all the "linux*" packages.

=== Things I could do better ===

I often feel I could improve with finding the right questions to ask in quicker time. I enjoy going down research rabbit holes, though sometimes it's best to ask for help for the sake of time. I believe I am getting better at determining when to ask for help sooner and it's an area I'll continue to work on bettering.
